analyzed: dad pa'i dbang las byung ba'i ro'i dga' ba bskyed pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis rab tu bsdus so //
translated: In order to generate the joy of the flesh that arises from the power of faith, the Bodhisattvas have gathered.

original: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis de rnams la byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pas bzlog pa mdzad do //
analyzed: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis de rnams la byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pas bzlog pa mdzad do //
translated: Then the Tathagatas, with ‚ÄúBodhisattva‚Äù and so on, have them turn back.

original: sdug bsngal gsum ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyi sdug bsngal lo //üîΩbyang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gsum ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyi sdug bsngal lo // byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la /
translated: The three sufferings are the sufferings of body, speech, and mind.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa stsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa stsol to //
translated: The Bodhisattvas, with ‚ÄúBhagavat‚Äù and so on, offer to the Tathagatas.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis dris pa can /üîΩyang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das @311a * //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis dris pa can / yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das @311a * //
translated: Why is that? The Tathagatas ask.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa stsol to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa stsol to //
translated: Again, the Bodhisattvas, with ‚ÄúBhagavat‚Äù and so on, offer.

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs gsang ba dag kho na rang bzhin gyis rnams par dag pa'i yi ge rnams yin pas na /
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs gsang ba dag kho na rang bzhin gyis rnams par dag pa'i yi ge rnams yin pas na /
translated: The secret of body, speech, and mind is just the naturally pure syllables.

original: gsang ba gsum gyi yi ge rnams yin zhing de rnams kyi ming tsam thos pa'i skal pa yang ma mchis na zhes sngon gyi dus kyi rigs ma nges pa dang / rigs chad pa rnams dang / lhan cig rgyud tha mi dad par byas nas de skad du brjod do //
analyzed: gsang ba gsum gyi yi ge rnams yin zhing de rnams kyi ming tsam thos pa'i skal pa yang ma mchis na zhes sngon gyi dus kyi rigs ma nges pa dang / rigs chad pa rnams dang / lhan cig rgyud tha mi dad par byas nas de skad du brjod do //
translated: The syllables of the three secrets are the cause of the Tathagatas, and if those of uncertain lineage and those of severed lineage in the past, who did not have the good fortune even to hear the mere name of those syllables, were to hear the name of the Tathagatas, they would attain supreme and perfect enlightenment.

original: don dam pa'i chos nyid bstan pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis de skad ma zer cig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: don dam pa'i chos nyid bstan pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis de skad ma zer cig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach the ultimate reality, the Tathagatas said, ‚ÄúDo not say that!‚Äù

original: ma thob ces bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: ma thob ces bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: ‚ÄúNot attained‚Äù means from the perspective of apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rtogs par bya ba la sogs pa'i rtog pa med pas na mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rtogs par bya ba la sogs pa'i rtog pa med pas na mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas so //
translated: For that very reason, since there is no conceptualization of realization, etc., they are not fully enlightened.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis dris pa na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis dris pa na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis gsang ba'i gnas gsum gyis yi ge rnam par dag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis gsang ba'i gnas gsum gyis yi ge rnam par dag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs te /
translated: Because the purity of the syllables is the three secret places of the Tathagatas.

original: sku la sogs pa gsang ba'i gnas rnams kyi rnam par dag pa ni de bzhin nyid de de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sku la sogs pa gsang ba'i gnas rnams kyi rnam par dag pa ni de bzhin nyid de de'i phyir ro //
translated: The purity of the secret places, such as the body, is suchness.

original: de skad thos nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams cang mi smra bar gyur to //
analyzed: de skad thos nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams cang mi smra bar gyur to //
translated: Having heard this, the Bodhisattvas became silent.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje'i dpal rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje'i dpal rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: The glorious Vajrasattva is the vajra body, speech, and mind of all Tathagatas.

original: de'i btsun mo ni kun du bzang mo ste /
analyzed: de'i btsun mo ni kun du bzang mo ste /
translated: His queen is Samantabhadri.

original: de'i bha ga la bya ba thams cad dang bral zhing mchog tu bde ba la dgyes pa'i rdo rje 'chang chen po rang gi 'khor gyi rig ma dang gnyis su med pa'i sbyor bas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang tha mi dad par gyur pas bzhugs so
analyzed: de'i bha ga la bya ba thams cad dang bral zhing mchog tu bde ba la dgyes pa'i rdo rje 'chang chen po rang gi 'khor gyi rig ma dang gnyis su med pa'i sbyor bas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang tha mi dad par gyur pas bzhugs so
translated: In her bhaga, Great Vajradhara, free from all activity, and delighted in supreme bliss, dwells in union with his consort, the knowledge woman, inseparable from all Tathagatas.

original: // de nas rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can zhi ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis lha mo bzhis sems can ma lus pa sdud pa'i snying rje chen po'i bdag nyid can gyi rdo rje 'chang chen po ye shes kyi
analyzed: // de nas rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can zhi ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis lha mo bzhis sems can ma lus pa sdud pa'i snying rje chen po'i bdag nyid can gyi rdo rje 'chang chen po ye shes kyi
translated: Then, the four goddesses, whose nature is the doors of liberation such as emptiness, and whose nature is peace, etc.,

original: gnyid log pa la glu rnams kyis rab tu bskul lo //
analyzed: gnyid log pa la glu rnams kyis rab tu bskul lo //
translated: with songs, arouse the great Vajradhara, whose nature is great compassion that embraces all sentient beings, from his wisdom sleep.

original: re zhig snying rje chen po'i bdag nyid can gyi dpal rdo rje sems dpa' sems can rnams mgron du gnyer nas /
analyzed: re zhig snying rje chen po'i bdag nyid can gyi dpal rdo rje sems dpa' sems can rnams mgron du gnyer nas /
translated: First, the glorious Vajrasattva, whose nature is great compassion, invites sentient beings as guests.

original: ji ltar rnam par mi rtog pa nyid du gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par mi rtog pa nyid du gyur /
translated: How does he become non-conceptual?

original: gal te gyur du bcug na ci'i phyir stong @311b pa nyid la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can gyi lha mo rnams kyis rab tu skul bar byed ce na /
analyzed: gal te gyur du bcug na ci'i phyir stong @311b pa nyid la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can gyi lha mo rnams kyis rab tu skul bar byed ce na /
translated: If he is allowed to become so, why do the goddesses whose nature is emptiness, etc., arouse him?

original: 'dir rigs pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir rigs pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: Here, a reasoning is stated:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni gsal zhing dri ma med pa'i sku can yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni gsal zhing dri ma med pa'i sku can yin no //
translated: The Tathagatas have clear and stainless bodies.

original: de'i phyir nye bar gyur pa'i me long gnyis nyid kyi gzugs brnyan bzhin du lha mo rnams kyi stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i rnam pa rdo rje 'chang chen po las 'byung ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir nye bar gyur pa'i me long gnyis nyid kyi gzugs brnyan bzhin du lha mo rnams kyi stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i rnam pa rdo rje 'chang chen po las 'byung ste /
translated: Therefore, like the two images of the proximate mirror, the aspects of emptiness, etc. of the goddesses arise from Great Vajradhara.

original: de'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa nyid du gyur to //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa nyid du gyur to //
translated: Therefore, he becomes non-conceptual.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs rdo rje lha mo rnams la 'byung bas de'i phyir rab tu skul bar byed do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs rdo rje lha mo rnams la 'byung bas de'i phyir rab tu skul bar byed do //
translated: Since the goddesses of the mind-vajra of the Lord arise from him, therefore, he impels them.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi btsun mo ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi btsun mo ste /
translated: He is the queen of the body, speech, and mind of all the Ones-Gone-Thus.

original: 'phags pa m'a ma k'is sa 'dzin pa dang / drug las skyes pa la sogs pa snyan cing 'jam pa'i dbyangs rnams kyis rnam par thar ba'i sgo bzhi'i bdag nyid can gyi rdo rje 'chang chen po la 'gro ba ma lus pa 'don pa'i bdag nyid can gyi snying rje chen po'i dga' bas skul bar byed do
analyzed: 'phags pa m'a ma k'is sa 'dzin pa dang / drug las skyes pa la sogs pa snyan cing 'jam pa'i dbyangs rnams kyis rnam par thar ba'i sgo bzhi'i bdag nyid can gyi rdo rje 'chang chen po la 'gro ba ma lus pa 'don pa'i bdag nyid can gyi snying rje chen po'i dga' bas skul bar byed do
translated: The noble one Mamaki, with her melodious and gentle voice, impels Great Vajradhara, who is the nature of the four doors of liberation, with the joy of great compassion, which has the nature of saving all transmigrating beings.

original: // khyod ni rdo rje'i thugs zhes bya bas ni /üîΩthugs rdo rje'i sgo nas bod pa'o //
analyzed: // khyod ni rdo rje'i thugs zhes bya bas ni / thugs rdo rje'i sgo nas bod pa'o //
translated: You are called the Vajra Mind.üîΩBy this, he is praised from the point of view of the Vajra Mind.

original: 'di la mi phyed pa'i thugs mnga' bas na rdo rje'i thugs te /
analyzed: 'di la mi phyed pa'i thugs mnga' bas na rdo rje'i thugs te /
translated: He is called the Vajra Mind because he has an indivisible mind,

original: don dam pa byang chub kyi sems kyi rang bzhin no //üîΩde nyid longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skus chos 'byung gi nang na gnas pa'i gzhal yas khang du bdag po'i gzugs su bzhugs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don dam pa byang chub kyi sems kyi rang bzhin no // de nyid longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skus chos 'byung gi nang na gnas pa'i gzhal yas khang du bdag po'i gzugs su bzhugs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: which is the nature of the ultimate mind of enlightenment.

original: sems can khams na gnas kyi dbang phyug go //
analyzed: sems can khams na gnas kyi dbang phyug go //
translated: He is the Lord of the world of sentient beings, because he is the very one who abides in the form of the Lord in the celestial mansion located in the center of the Dharma Realm with the Body of Perfect Rapture.

original: bdag la bskyab tu gsol zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bdag la bskyab tu gsol zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Please protect me.

original: 'dod chags kyi spyod pa can gyi sems can gyi rang bzhin bdag la bskyab tu gsol ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi spyod pa can gyi sems can gyi rang bzhin bdag la bskyab tu gsol ba'o //

original: gang dag ce na /üîΩdga' ba yid 'ong don chen 'dod pas zhes bya bas gsungs te /
analyzed: gang dag ce na / dga' ba yid 'ong don chen 'dod pas zhes bya bas gsungs te /
translated: Who is he?üîΩHe is the one who is called the Vajra Mind, who is the Lord of the world of sentient beings, who is the one who is praised by the Bodhisattvas, and who is the one who is the object of worship of all the Buddhas.

original: de la dga' ba ni byang chub kyi sems phyung ba'i bde ba chen po'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: de la dga' ba ni byang chub kyi sems phyung ba'i bde ba chen po'i rnam pa'o //
translated: He is the one who is called the Vajra Mind because he has an indivisible mind, which is the nature of the ultimate mind of enlightenment.

original: de nyid yid dga' bar byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir yid du 'ong ba'o ;
analyzed: de nyid yid dga' bar byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir yid du 'ong ba'o ;
translated: It is pleasing because it delights the mind.

original: / des bskyed pa'i don chen 'dod pa ni thams cad las phul du byung ba'i dkyil 'khor pa rnams kyis zhe sdang la sogs pa'i spyod pa can gyi sems can gyi khams rnam par sbyong ba'i rang bzhin te /

translated: The great meaning generated by that is the desire to purify the realm of sentient beings who have the conduct of hatred, etc., with the mandala that is the best of all.

original: des bdag gi mngon par 'dod pa bsgrubs shig pa'o //
analyzed: des bdag gi mngon par 'dod pa bsgrubs shig pa'o //
translated: Please accomplish my desire!

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: @312a * // 'di ltar sems can thams cad skyed par mdzad pa dang / de dag mngon par gdon par bya ba la gnyen mchog tu gyur pa ste /
analyzed: @312a * // 'di ltar sems can thams cad skyed par mdzad pa dang / de dag mngon par gdon par bya ba la gnyen mchog tu gyur pa ste /
translated: Because you are the best friend of all sentient beings, who are to be liberated,

original: de'i 'dod chags kyi spyod pa can gyi sems can gyi khams kyi rang bzhin bdag de rnam par sbyong ba'i thabs kyis 'tsho bar byed pas gson par mdzad du gsol zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i 'dod chags kyi spyod pa can gyi sems can gyi khams kyi rang bzhin bdag de rnam par sbyong ba'i thabs kyis 'tsho bar byed pas gson par mdzad du gsol zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: and you are the life of those sentient beings who have the conduct of passion, because you make them live by the method of purifying their nature.

original: da ni spyan gyis skul bar byed de /
analyzed: da ni spyan gyis skul bar byed de /
translated: Now he urges with his eyes:

original: rdo rje sku khyod ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: rdo rje sku khyod ces bya ba ni /
translated: O Vajra Body!

original: sku rdo rje'i sgo nas bod pa'o //
analyzed: sku rdo rje'i sgo nas bod pa'o //
translated: He is the protector of Tibet through the vajra of body.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: For what reason?

original: khyod sems can mang po la phan pa mdzad cing dkon mchog gsum la sogs pa la gnod pa byed pa rnams la bka'i 'khor lo sbyor bar mdzad pa yang yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: khyod sems can mang po la phan pa mdzad cing dkon mchog gsum la sogs pa la gnod pa byed pa rnams la bka'i 'khor lo sbyor bar mdzad pa yang yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: Because you apply the wheel of law to those who benefit many sentient beings and to those who harm the three jewels and so forth.

original: sangs rgyas don ni chos thams cad rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas don ni chos thams cad rtogs pa'o //
translated: The meaning of buddha is the realization of all phenomena.

original: byang chub ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ma'o //
analyzed: byang chub ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ma'o //
translated: Awakening is the perfection of wisdom.

original: don dam pa ni yang dag par sbyor ba'i bde ba chen po ste /
analyzed: don dam pa ni yang dag par sbyor ba'i bde ba chen po ste /
translated: The ultimate is the great bliss of correct application.

original: de dag sems can rnams la phan gdags pa'i bsam pas ston cing 'chad par mdzad pa'o //üîΩchags pas zhes bya ba ni rab tu dga' ba'i spyod pa la zhugs pa'i sems can gyi khams rnam par sbyong ba'i rang bzhin gyis so //
analyzed: de dag sems can rnams la phan gdags pa'i bsam pas ston cing 'chad par mdzad pa'o // chags pas zhes bya ba ni rab tu dga' ba'i spyod pa la zhugs pa'i sems can gyi khams rnam par sbyong ba'i rang bzhin gyis so //
translated: You teach and explain those with the intention of benefiting sentient beings.üîΩ‚ÄúAttachment‚Äù is the nature of purifying the realm of sentient beings who have entered the conduct of supreme joy.

original: 'dod chags dam tshig ni 'dod chags kyi spyod pa can gyi sems can rnams kyi rgyud rnam par sbyong ba'i rang bzhin can te /
analyzed: 'dod chags dam tshig ni 'dod chags kyi spyod pa can gyi sems can rnams kyi rgyud rnam par sbyong ba'i rang bzhin can te /
translated: The pledge of desire is the nature of purifying the mindstreams of sentient beings who have the conduct of desire.

original: bdag la dgyes par mdzad cing sten par mdzad du gsol zhes bya ba'i don to /
analyzed: bdag la dgyes par mdzad cing sten par mdzad du gsol zhes bya ba'i don to /
translated: Please be pleased with me and attend to me is the meaning.

original: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as before.

original: 'jig rten dbang phyug ni 'od dpag tu med pa yin zhing de'i sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi spyan te /
analyzed: 'jig rten dbang phyug ni 'od dpag tu med pa yin zhing de'i sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi spyan te /
translated: The Lord of the World is Amitabha, and his eye of body, speech, and mind is the eye of the three vajras.

original: gos dkar mos rdo rje 'chang chen po la rab tu bskul ba'o //
analyzed: gos dkar mos rdo rje 'chang chen po la rab tu bskul ba'o //
translated: Pavitravatl implores Great Vajradhara, saying, You, who are the vajra speech.

original: khyod ni rdo rje'i gsung zhes bya ba ni gsung gi sgo nas bcom ldan 'das la bod pa'o //
analyzed: khyod ni rdo rje'i gsung zhes bya ba ni gsung gi sgo nas bcom ldan 'das la bod pa'o //
translated: By means of speech, she addresses the Lord, saying, You, who are the vajra speech.

original: kun la zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi khams lus pa bzang ba med pa la'o //
analyzed: kun la zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi khams lus pa bzang ba med pa la'o //
translated: To all means to the realm of sentient beings, without exception, who are not well-disposed.

original: phan zhing thugs brtse ba zhes bya ba ni /üîΩma 'ongs pa na phan pa mdzad pa'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: phan zhing thugs brtse ba zhes bya ba ni / ma 'ongs pa na phan pa mdzad pa'i bdag nyid can no //
translated: Beneficent and compassionate means that.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'jig rten rnams kyi don bya ba'i phyir dus rtag tu yang dag par brtson pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'jig rten rnams kyi don bya ba'i phyir dus rtag tu yang dag par brtson pa'o //
translated: In the future, he is the one who has the nature of benefiting, and for that very reason, always striving to benefit the world.

original: spyod pa dri med ni rab tu dga' ba skyed par byed pa'i 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: spyod pa dri med ni rab tu dga' ba skyed par byed pa'i 'jug pa'o //
translated: Pure conduct is the engagement that produces the joy of the first stage.

original: des sems can gyi khams @312b ma lus pa bzang po ste /
analyzed: des sems can gyi khams @312b ma lus pa bzang po ste /
translated: It is good because it is the cause of the complete purification of the realms of sentient beings.üîΩ

original: dge legs thob par mdzad pas na kun du bzang po'o //
analyzed: dge legs thob par mdzad pas na kun du bzang po'o //
translated: He is Samantabhadra, the universal good, because he has obtained the good, the auspicious, for the entire realm of sentient beings.

original: bdag la dgyes par mdzod ces bya ba ni bdag la longs spyad par mdzod cig pa'o //
analyzed: bdag la dgyes par mdzod ces bya ba ni bdag la longs spyad par mdzod cig pa'o //
translated: Please be pleased with me means please enjoy yourself with me.

original: gzhan ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: gzhan ni bshad zin to //
translated: The rest is self-evident.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi dam tshig rdo rje ni don yod par grub pa yin zhing /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi dam tshig rdo rje ni don yod par grub pa yin zhing /
translated: The pledge vajra of the body, speech, and mind of all the Ones-Gone-Thus is Amoghasiddhi.

original: de'i btsun mo ste 'phags ma sgrol mas rdo rje 'chang chen po la rab tu bskul ba'o //
analyzed: de'i btsun mo ste 'phags ma sgrol mas rdo rje 'chang chen po la rab tu bskul ba'o //
translated: His queen, the noble Tara, implores Great Vajradhara.

original: khyod ni rdo rje 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni sprul pa mtha' yas pa rnams kyis sems can rnams kyis mngon par 'dod pa'i don sgrub par byed pa'o ;
analyzed: khyod ni rdo rje 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni sprul pa mtha' yas pa rnams kyis sems can rnams kyis mngon par 'dod pa'i don sgrub par byed pa'o ;
translated: You are the vajra desire, means that by means of your infinite emanations you accomplish the aims desired by sentient beings.

original: / don yod par grub pa'i sgo nas las kyi rigs kyi bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir dam tshig go //
analyzed: / don yod par grub pa'i sgo nas las kyi rigs kyi bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir dam tshig go //
translated: Since Amoghasiddhi is the nature of the karma family, he is the pledge.

original: sems can ma lus pa rnams kyi mchog tu phan pa'i don mdzad pa'i phan don che'o //
analyzed: sems can ma lus pa rnams kyi mchog tu phan pa'i don mdzad pa'i phan don che'o //
translated: He is of great benefit, since he acts for the benefit of all sentient beings without exception.

original: zhe sdang ni rab tu phrag dog rnam par sbyong ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi gdung mchog go //
analyzed: zhe sdang ni rab tu phrag dog rnam par sbyong ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi gdung mchog go //
translated: He is the best of the lineage of the perfect Buddhas, since he is the very essence of the purification of intense envy.

original: gsod pa la sogs pa la zhugs pa'i sems can rnams kyang gdon par dgongs pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir mtshungs par brtser ldan pa'o //
analyzed: gsod pa la sogs pa la zhugs pa'i sems can rnams kyang gdon par dgongs pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir mtshungs par brtser ldan pa'o //
translated: He is endowed with compassion, since he is the very essence of the intention to rescue sentient beings who are engaged in killing and so on.

original: gzhan ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: gzhan ni bshad zin to //
translated: The others have been explained.

original: yon tan rin chen mang po'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: yon tan rin chen mang po'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: By the verse, A multitude of precious qualities, etc.,

original: bdag ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga rnam pa mang pos dga' zhing mchog tu zad pa med pa'i bde ba rgyas par byed pa yin no zhes bdag nyid phul du byung ba yin par ston to //
analyzed: bdag ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga rnam pa mang pos dga' zhing mchog tu zad pa med pa'i bde ba rgyas par byed pa yin no zhes bdag nyid phul du byung ba yin par ston to //
translated: he shows that he is preeminent, since he is the one who delights in the many varieties of the five sense-qualities and who expands the bliss that is absolutely inexhaustible.

original: 'dod pa thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa la bcom ldan 'das kyi rnam pa thams cad du 'dod par bya ba yin pas na 'dod pa thams cad de lha mo rnams so //
analyzed: 'dod pa thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa la bcom ldan 'das kyi rnam pa thams cad du 'dod par bya ba yin pas na 'dod pa thams cad de lha mo rnams so //
translated: As for all desires, and so on, the Blessed One is all desires because he is to be desired in every way, that is, the goddesses.

original: de dag la nye bar longs spyod pa ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i bya bas bde ba chen po'i ro myong ba'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: de dag la nye bar longs spyod pa ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i bya bas bde ba chen po'i ro myong ba'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The enjoyment of them is the experience of the taste of great bliss through the action of meditative concentration.üîΩ The glory of that is the consecration of the realm of sentient beings by the consecration rite explained here.

original: ting nge 'dzin gang la de'i dpal te sems can gyi khams sbyar bas ni 'di las bshad pa'i cho ga bzhin du dbang bskur ba med na /üîΩrgyud 'di mnyan pa la sogs pa'i //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gang la de'i dpal te sems can gyi khams sbyar bas ni 'di las bshad pa'i cho ga bzhin du dbang bskur ba med na / rgyud 'di mnyan pa la sogs pa'i //
translated: Without that,

original: skal ba med pa zhes bstan to //
analyzed: skal ba med pa zhes bstan to //
translated: it is taught that one is not fit to listen to this tantra, and so on.

original: de nas rdo rje chos kyis kyang bdag nyid snod du rung ba nyid du shes nas de bzhin du bgyi'o zhes thams cad bzung bar gyur to //
analyzed: de nas rdo rje chos kyis kyang bdag nyid snod du rung ba nyid du shes nas de bzhin du bgyi'o zhes thams cad bzung bar gyur to //
translated: Then Vajradharma, knowing that he himself was a fit vessel, said, I will do it, and accepted the whole thing.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs @313a * //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs @313a * //
translated: Then, with Then, and so on,

original: pas ni // nye bar bsdu ba'i cho ga de nyid gsal bar byed de /
analyzed: pas ni // nye bar bsdu ba'i cho ga de nyid gsal bar byed de /
translated: he clarifies the rite of the summary.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: All the Tathagatas are Vairochana, etc.

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi bdag nyid can gyi rdo rje 'chang chen po ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa' ste /
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi bdag nyid can gyi rdo rje 'chang chen po ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa' ste /
translated: The Great Vajradhara, who is the nature of body, speech, and mind, is the glorious Vajrasattva.

original: de'i mgo dang lkog ma dang / snying ga'i phyogs na gnas pa'i ye shes gsum la sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje rnams btsud par gyur to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i mgo dang lkog ma dang / snying ga'i phyogs na gnas pa'i ye shes gsum la sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje rnams btsud par gyur to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The three wisdoms, which are located in the head, throat, and heart regions, are inserted into the vajras of body, speech, and mind.

original: khams gsum thams cad kyi lus rdo rje la zhes bya ba ni brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i khams gsum ma lus pa'i dngos po'i snang ba la'o //
analyzed: khams gsum thams cad kyi lus rdo rje la zhes bya ba ni brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i khams gsum ma lus pa'i dngos po'i snang ba la'o //
translated: In all the bodies of the three realms means in the appearances of the things of the entire realm of the three worlds, both moving and unmoving.

original: gnas shing zhes bya ba ni de'i bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin kho nar gnas pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gnas shing zhes bya ba ni de'i bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin kho nar gnas pa yin gyi /
translated: Abiding means abiding in the nature of just that.

original: rten dang brten pa'i sgo nas ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rten dang brten pa'i sgo nas ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not in the manner of a support and something supported.

original: sku mnyam pa nyid ni khams gsum pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin med pa nyid de /
analyzed: sku mnyam pa nyid ni khams gsum pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin med pa nyid de /
translated: The sameness of body is the non-existence of the nature of things of the three realms.
